addressleaf.section: To the right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

26 Fe
b
1594.
M
r
Bodeleie to my L. From
e Haghe.
W
th
e Copies of 2 intercepted l
re
s./

page.lettertext:
fol.61r
May it please yo
r
good L. to receave the copies
heerw
t
of two intercepted l
re
s, containing somwhat,
in my judgement, worthe the sending to yo
r
L.
They were written from
Brussels,
and sent for
Rome:
one to
e Cardinal Coetan, and
e other to the G
nr
al
of
e Jesuites, by one
William Creytton
a Scottishe Je-
suite: who I thinke heeretofore hath bin knowen to
yo
r
L. and is a man, as I have heard, of good ac-
count and respect among those of his profession.
Having written at length, about fower daies past,
of mine owne negotiations, and somwhat in
e inclosed
to be imparted to yo
r
L. by
S
r
Robert Cecill
,
I take
my humble leave. From
e Hage. Fe
b
26 1594.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
I am informed by Scottishe
men heere, that
Thomas Tyrie
, of
whome the intercept ed make
mention, is nephew to
James Tyrie
the famous Jesuite that professed
in
Paris,
and nowe in Rome. The
wife of Thomas and
e L. Humes
are brother and sisters children.
